residents from either world find themselves inevitably drawn to the border between their realms.

monsters, insane criminals, ruthless hitmen, anarchists,agents of anti-government organizations, armed refugees -- a den of villainous scum.
a free city of darkness ruled by the silent order of these outlaws.
this is japan's largest abandoned city, amidahara.

to why i'm getting dragged along by these guys.
hey, seeing as we're out in kyoto, let's go check outamidahara!
the adventure began with those curious words.
let's go see what amidahara, japan's biggest abandoned city is all about.
for school trip memories and stories to tell.
i don't even remember who suggested it first.
i feel like it was one of my friends… or i guess it could've been me.
either way, before i knew it everyone was like, "let's go!
abandoned city amidahara.
there isn't a soul around who hasn't heard the name.
even those without any interest.
the prosperous city, once hailed as the third largest injapan got swept up in a peninsular conflict turned proxy war between the uac and the chinese union…
…and took a particularly nasty warhead.
some say it wasn't a new kind of missile, but a large scale magic -- which does exist, mind you -- whose ritual went wrong.
but whatever it was, the mighty city of wealth and prosperity was reduced to ruins in an instant.
then… the "gates" opened.
they appeared simultaneously all over the world -- gates leading to the demon world.
again, i don't know whether "demon world" means they led to the actual realm of the devil or what.
all i know is that otherworldly creatures that defied all conventional biology and genetics stepped forth from these "gates.
namely, the inhabitants of the demon world.
they say the "gate" that appeared in amidahara was a particularly big one.
that was about ten years ago.
the inhabitants of the demon world began to settle within the ruins soon after, primarily around the area leading back to their world.
and as if sensing opportunity, human outlaws began to gather as well, and before long it had matured into the largest abandoned city in japan.
well, ignoring whether "matured" would be the right word here, it eventually grew into a large town regardless.
natural law dictates that once a town gets big enough, a booming entertainment district will spring up on the line between anarchy and the law.
those seeking thrills found nowhere else flooded in from all over the country, providing the financial lifeblood for the abandonded city and continued to fuel its growth.
there's no way a couple strapping young students like us wouldn't be fascinated by such tales.
but we forgot in our unchecked curiosity that amidahara is also the most dangerous city in all japan.
it had completely slipped my mind until i got separated from everyone in all the excitement, got lost in the twists and turns of the city and was captured by slavers.
a great man once said,
there's no use crying over spilt milk.
and then there's one more.
the trip's not over until you make it back home.
talk about stupid… i'm such a moron.

i'm paralyzed by the terrible scene… no, by the terrible figure before me.

name: rikurou
normalized: what… is she…?
my voice is shaking more now than when i was being shot at.

name: rikurou
normalized: wh-what the hell is she…!?
a witch?
is that what a witch is?
she turned that monster of a man into a bloody stain in the blink of an eye.
you're telling me that's a witch!?

name: slaver
normalized: remember this, kid.
mustache who had been watching beside me rises in awe.

name: slaver
normalized: they say that big sword annerose lugs around, kongo yasha, is the embodiment of a nasty, evil-devouring demon god.
yeah, a devil alright.

name: rikurou
normalized: that sword's… a devil…?
he nods.

name: slaver
normalized: she made a deal with the devil.
got me on what she gave up, though.

name: rikurou
normalized: a-a deal with the devil…!?
that kinda stuff actually exists!?

name: slaver
normalized: the hell!?
devil dealin' is what witches're all about!
you really don't know shit, do you kid?
at the rate you're goin' you're gonna get snagged by some dirty trader.

name: slaver
normalized: the hell're you calling a dirty trader!?
oh, right, you're already sold goods, aint'cha?
tch… hey kid, you listenin' to me?
oh, i'm listening alright.
i heard it.
like it was crystal clear.
that's right, i've been sold.
to that witch.
that terrifying witch.
the witch annerose.
she's coming back this way.
there's not a drop of sweat on her even after such an intense exchange.
the demon sword in her right hand had reverted back to its graceful, slender shape at some point as well.

name: annerose
normalized: how long are you going to lie around down there, boy?
here, on your feet.
she says coolly.

name: rikurou
normalized: s-sorry!
i let out a pathetically high-pitched squeak as i pop up like a broken marionette.

name: annerose
normalized: aha, there's nothing to be afraid of.
no, there absolutely is.
that smile is terrifying.
seriously.

name: annerose
normalized: now then…"
annerose ignores me standing here petrified and turns to the slaver.

name: annerose
normalized: i'll be taking the boy as agreed, old man.

name: slaver
normalized: keh!
do whatever you want.
wait, aren't we missing something here?
what about me?
don't i get a say in all this?

name: annerose
normalized: i will, thank you.
i think we'll have exceptional affinity.
this one's got talent.
huh?
talent?

name: slaver
normalized: woah, hold on now, he does!?
but then you, but that means…"

name: annerose
normalized: hmhm, bullseye.

name: slaver
normalized: aagh, i could've made a fortune if it weren't for all this shit!
there's no way a kid who gets snatched up this easy has talent!

name: annerose
normalized: my condolences.
so… what are they talking about again?
something about talent or something.
are they talking about me?
nah, there's no way.
i'm the last guy you could say hasany sort of talent.
still, i can't put my finger on it, but i'm getting a really bad feeling as i listen to them go back and forth.
there's plenty i want to say, but my frozen shut mouth doesn't want to cooperate.
w-wait… putting all that aside, there's no denying that she did save my life.
i should thank her first.
yeah, saying thanks comes first.
no matter how scary a witch is, she wouldn't turn around and kill a weakling like me out of nowhere, right?

name: rikurou
normalized: um, i…"
but the moment i open my mouth, annerose turns back to face me.

name: annerose
normalized: well, boy, from this day forward you belong to me.
excuse me?
slap.
huh!?
what just happened!?
w-wait?
i'm flying?
i'm… flying?
it suddenly feels like i'm flying through the air for somereason.
actually, this doesn't feel too bad…
wait, hold on.
the moment i start to put together what happened…

name: rikurou
normalized: ow…!
i feel a sudden impact.
on what?
the ground.
the ground!?
my head just hit the ground!?
then, i see "my" body.
--my headless body.

name: rikurou
normalized: …huh?
whoa!?
wait!
whaat!?
hold on, just wait a second here!
if i'm looking from over here, and my headless body's over there…
n-no way.

name: slaver
normalized: aagh, she actually did it!
i see the slaver throw his hands up near the top of my field of vision.

name: rikurou
normalized: hey… y…"
my consciousness is fading.
she really did it.
she turned around and killed me out of nowhere.
but, why…?

name: rikurou
normalized: i… don'…"
the feel of soft palms on my cheeks.
the sense of being lifted.
the last thing i see…
is the face of the witch who cut my head off.
that bewitching…
…yet beautiful smile.

name: annerose
normalized: and now you belong to me.
her face is getting closer.
but i can't see so well anymore.
the moment my mind sinks into the darkness.
ah…
i think she kissed me.
a tongue-in-your-mouth, passionate kiss.
and then… i died.
